results.title: Investigating hibernation: the golden-mantled ground squirrel
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Thomas Smith
results.brief_description: Investigates the underlying mechanism of hibernation and the concept of biological clocks. Squirrels still hibernate in the alien laboratory environment. The film shows clearly the arousal-increase in pulse rate, deeper breathing, shivering and contortions and the fully awakened normal temperature state.
results.description: Investigates the underlying mechanism of hibernation and the concept of biological clocks. Squirrels still hibernate in the alien laboratory environment. results.title: Invest in a casting
results.creator_credit: British Information Services, Mottershaw Commercial Films, Alec Dalby and John Mottershaw
results.brief_description: Shows how the ancient lost-wax process for making castings is still used in investment casting. Follows the stages by which the ceramic die is prepared to receive the molten metal, the careful inspection of the die and the two different methods of casting. Demonstrates the whole process of casting and gives a series of examples of articles in common use made by investment casting.

results.title: Inventors of thingumajigs
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Paul Larose and Raymond Garceau
results.brief_description: This beautiful, humorous and mad film introduces us to a very special breed of people whose rarefied ideas suffer occasional setbacks. Whatever the invention - comb-cleaner, panty-hose, snowmobile - these “inventors of thingumajigs” are a valuable natural resource who contribute much to society.

results.title: Inventors and inventions
results.brief_description: Invention is as old as the human race and just as there are many different types of inventions, there are also many different types of inventors. This video introduces a variety of inventors - including professionals, amateurs, artists, scientists, adults and teenagers. Also illustrated is the point that inventions don’t always have to be useful and can often lead to unpredictable results - but that the same care and attention to detail applies to all inventions, practical or otherwise. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.

results.title: Invasion of the boneseed plants
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Peter Nagels
results.brief_description: Looks at the boneseed plant, a noxious weed that threatens native flora and fauna and is spreading at an alarming rate. Narrated by Tony Evans.

results.title: Introduction to Yoga
results.brief_description: In this video, especially made for beginners, Laliita Gilbert shows us: breathing, standing exercises, relaxation techniques. This highly instructive video introduces the viewer to the benefits of the essential philosophy and preparatory techniques of yoga.

results.title: Introduction to work sampling
results.creator_credit: University of California, Los Angeles and Oscar Patterson
results.brief_description: Points out that single or unsystematical observations may give quite erroneous ideas of how efficiently a worker is employed. Explains the “random” concept in statistics, using a bowl of 10,000 marbles of two colors. Applies the random sample method to a model of a machinist’s working day. Presents the claim that work sampling can provide many results of stop-watch time-and-motion study: standard hours of production work; average performance index; indication of idle time and delay causes.

results.title: Introduction to the performing arts: opera with Henry Butler
results.creator_credit: Robert Saudek Associates, Learning Corporation of America, Robert Saudek and Roger Englander
results.brief_description: Henry Butler, stage director for the New York Metropolitan Opera Company, comments on the emotional inspiration for opera, famous opera houses, and trends in opera today. Includes interviews with the performers, and long extracts from performances of La Traviata and I Pagliacci.

results.title: Introduction to the end of an argument = Intifada - Speaking for Oneself, Speaking for Others
results.brief_description: This experimental documentary by Lebanese/Canadian artist, Jayce Salloum and New York based Palestinian filmmaker Elia Suleiman, deconstructs commonplace (mis)impressions of the Palestinian Intifada, an uprising understood primarily through Western media imagery. Drawing on Hollywood, European, and Israeli feature films, cartoons, documentaries, news coverage and excerpts of ‘live’ footage shot in the West Bank and Gaza strip, the film makes connections between media constructions of the Intifada and stereotypical visual representations of the Middle East, Arab culture, and the Palestinian people. Creating a collage that combines this diverse visual imagery with text, the documentary mimics the dominant media’s forms of representation, subverting its methodology and construction, in an attempt to to expose the racial biases concealed in familiar images. In doing so it goes beyond presenting a mere compendium of Arab stereotypes to demonstrate how repeated phrases and images contribute to the formation of US foreign policy on the Middle East region. In Arabic and English with English subtitles.
